== Biography ==
George Callender was born in Stockton-on-Tees, County Durham in about 1819<ref>
'''"England and Wales Census, 1881,"''' database with images, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:Q27B-T3M8 : 12 December 2017),
George Callender, Norton, Durham, England; from "1881 England, Scotland and Wales Census," database and images, findmypast (http://www.findmypast.com : n.d.);
citing p. 5, Piece/Folio 4894/109, The National Archives, Kew, Surrey; FHL microfilm 101,775,358.
</ref>He married [[Best-7946|Alice Best]] in Stockton-on-Tees Parish Church on 29 August 1866.<ref>
'''"FreeBMD GRO Marriage Index,"''' database with images, ''FreeBMD'' https://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=l%2B2b4v%2FUcxgwlkBAa%2FD7eA&scan=1  : 19-Feb-2024),
George Callender, 1866, quarter 3, vol. 10a, p. 91, Stockton, County Durham, England,
citing General Register Office, Southport, England.
</ref>. Alice died in January 1869 and George married [[xccc]] on 3 October 1869.<ref>
'''"FreeBMD GRO Marriage Index,"''' database with images, ''FreeBMD'' https://www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl?cite=3TfalwmlGO%2BE4onthUB0xA&scan=1  : 19-Feb-2024),
George Callender, 1869, quarter 4, vol. 10a, p. 97, Stockton, County Durham, England,
citing General Register Office, Southport, England.
</ref>
George died at 33 Windsor Road, Stockton-on-Tees on 7 May 1891 when he was 73 years old.
